ovdesc.p: DX.COMMISSION is a powerful tool allowing users to define a wide range of charges, fees and commissions to be paid or received by any customer or portfolio set up to trade in the Derivatives module.
Commission sets may be defined by customer, group of customers, derivatives contract, derivatives contract class, or combinations of these criteria.

Once the appropriate commission set has been located for a particular trade, any item of data on a trade or an order may be tested either alone or in combination to generate rules for charges that may be as simple or elaborate as the user wishes.
The flexible charge definition functionality of the T24 standard charge definition applications FT.COMMISSION.TYPE and FT.CHARGE.TYPE is then used to generate the final charge and tax figures.

If the field entered in FIELD.NAME is one of the fields associated with the 'primary' customer(s) in DX.TRADE, then the equivalent field name on the 'secondary' side of the trade will be automatically populated into this field.
In this way, logical tests to determine which commission should be applied can be performed irrespective of whether the customer in question is on the primary or secondary side of the trade.

DX.CONTRACT.MASTER ID. Populated if this DX.COMMISSION record refers to a particular derivatives contract.
Field name from the application DX.TRADE, the contents of which will be used in a test to determine what commission should be applied to the relevant customer on the trade.

Because DX.TRADE is double sided and a customer may be entered as 'primary' on one trade but 'secondary' on another trade depending on the bank's requirements, only common fields (common to both primary and secondary customers) or 'primary' fields may be entered here. The 'secondary' field to be tested if appropriate will be defaulted into SEC.FLD.NME.
